page.description: Get a pointer to the DOM element for a UX component control.

argument.name: variableName
argument.description: The name of the control in the UX Component

description.p: Returns the HTML DOM element for the requested control. If no element exists, *[js:getPointer()]* returns *[js:false]*.

page.discussion: Get a pointer to the DOM element for a control, such as a text box, button, label, etc. so that you can manipulate the DOM element. Prefer to use this method over document.getElementById.

important.p: If the HTML element doesn't exist, getPointer() will return *[js:false]*. You should *[always]* check the returned value of the getPointer() method before using the object. This can be done by wrapping your code in an if block as shown in the example.
